name: TOEFL Core Vocabulary
description: Essential vocabulary for TOEFL exam preparation.

sentences: The captain gave the order to abandon ship.
He decided to abandon his plan.
The drug has no adverse side effects.
They received adverse criticism.
He advocates for environmental protection.
She is a strong advocate for education reform.
The building has great aesthetic value.
They made the decision based on aesthetic considerations.
The aggregate of all donations was impressive.
These small gains aggregate into a significant advantage.
The government will allocate funds for the project.
We need to allocate resources efficiently.

words.chinese: adj. 模棱两可的，不明确的
sentences: His answer was deliberately ambiguous.
The law is ambiguous on this issue.

words.chinese: adj. 有雄心的，野心勃勃的
sentences: She has ambitious plans for her career.
The project is highly ambitious in scope.
The constitution was amended to reflect new realities.
He offered to amend the proposal.
He used an analogy to explain the complex concept.
The analogy between the heart and a pump is common.
The company holds its annual meeting in December.
Her annual salary is quite competitive.
He felt a strong antipathy towards the proposal.
There is mutual antipathy between the two groups.
His happiness was apparent to everyone.
The apparent simplicity of the design is deceptive.
The charity appealed for donations.
The movie has wide appeal across age groups.
I truly appreciate your help.
Real estate values have appreciated significantly.
We are approaching a solution to the problem.
His approach to teaching is innovative.
Please wear appropriate attire for the interview.
The government appropriated funds for the new hospital.
The decision seemed arbitrary and unfair.
He made an arbitrary choice without consulting others.
We need to ascertain the facts before deciding.
The police are trying to ascertain his whereabouts.
We must consider every aspect of the problem.
Her cheerful aspect lifted everyone's spirits.
The team will assemble at 9 AM tomorrow.
It took hours to assemble the furniture.
He asserted his innocence throughout the trial.
She asserted her authority in the meeting.
We need to assess the damage caused by the storm.
The teacher will assess the students' progress.
Let's assume for a moment that you're right.
She will assume the role of director next month.

words.chinese: v./n. 把...归因于；属性，特性
sentences: He attributes his success to hard work.
Patience is an essential attribute for a teacher.
He took a second job to augment his income.
They used spices to augment the flavor of the dish.
This is an authentic painting by Van Gogh.
They serve authentic Italian cuisine.
He speaks with authority on the subject.
The local authorities are investigating the incident.
The manager is not available at the moment.
Various resources are available online.
Regular exercise is beneficial to your health.
The agreement is mutually beneficial.

words.chinese: n./v. 偏见，偏爱；使有偏见
sentences: The journalist tried to avoid bias in her reporting.
His upbringing biased him against modern art.
Brevity is the soul of wit.
He explained the complex idea with remarkable brevity.
She is a very capable manager.
This tool is capable of handling heavy loads.
The stadium has a capacity of 50,000 people.
He served in an advisory capacity.
Climbing the mountain was a great challenge.
She challenged the traditional way of thinking.
Could you clarify what you mean by that?
The statement was issued to clarify the company's position.
She presented a coherent argument.
The essay lacks a coherent structure.
Our vacations coincide this year.
His interests coincide with mine.
The two companies collaborated on the project.
Researchers from different fields collaborate frequently.
The ceremony will commence at noon.
He commenced his speech with a joke.
He made a positive comment about her work.
She declined to comment on the allegations.
The government set up a commission to investigate.
They commissioned an artist to paint the portrait.
She has a strong commitment to her family.
The company shows little commitment to sustainability.
Oil is a valuable global commodity.
The store sells various household commodities.
The software is compatible with all operating systems.
They are a compatible couple.
The company will compensate you for your loss.
Her enthusiasm compensates for her lack of experience.
She compiled a list of potential candidates.
The data was compiled from various sources.
The wine complements the cheese perfectly.
The two skills are complements to each other.
The report provides a comprehensive analysis.
She has a comprehensive understanding of the topic.
The committee comprises experts from various fields.
The collection comprises over 500 paintings.
I concede that you have a point.
The candidate conceded defeat after the results were announced.
It's hard to conceive of a world without electricity.
The plan was conceived last year.
Please concentrate on your work.
The industry is concentrated in the southern region.
The concept of time is difficult to explain.
She introduced a new concept in design.

words.chinese: adj. 同时发生的，并存的
sentences: The two events were concurrent.
He held two concurrent positions at the university.
They will conduct an experiment tomorrow.
His conduct during the meeting was professional.
Please confine your remarks to the topic.
The virus is confined to a small area.
Please confirm your attendance by Friday.
The test results confirmed the diagnosis.
There is a conflict of interest.
His account conflicts with the evidence.
All products must conform to safety standards.
He refused to conform to social norms.
You need written consent to proceed.
She consented to the interview.

words.chinese: adj. 随之发生的，作为结果的
sentences: The heavy rain and consequent flooding caused damage.
His resignation and the consequent reorganization surprised everyone.

words.chinese: adj. 相当大的，相当多的
sentences: The project requires considerable investment.
She has considerable experience in the field.
The committee consists of ten members.
Happiness does not consist in having many possessions.
He is under constant pressure at work.
The temperature remains constant.
Women constitute the majority of the workforce.
These actions constitute a violation of the agreement.

words.chinese: adj./n. 当代的，同时代的；同代人
sentences: She studies contemporary art.
He was a contemporary of Shakespeare.
You need to consider the historical context.
The meaning of a word depends on its context.
They signed a two-year contract.
Metals contract when cooled.
The witness contradicted the defendant's statement.
His actions contradict his words.

words.chinese: n./v. 对比，对照；形成对比
sentences: There is a sharp contrast between the two cultures.
His actions contrast sharply with his promises.
He contributed generously to the charity.
Many factors contributed to the accident.
The new policy sparked controversy.
There is considerable controversy over the issue.
The committee will convene next week.
The chairman convened an emergency meeting.
They conversed for hours about philosophy.
The converse is also true.
They converted the attic into a bedroom.
He converted to Buddhism last year.
I tried to convince him to change his mind.
The evidence convinced me of his innocence.
The two companies agreed to cooperate on the project.
She cooperated fully with the investigation.
